thread.title: Trump's personal attorney asks reporter, 'Where's the apology?'
thread.title_full: Trump's personal attorney asks reporter, 'Where's the apology?' | Washington Examiner

author: Daniel Chaitin
title: Trump's personal attorney asks reporter, 'Where's the apology?'
text:
President Trump 's personal attorney is looking for an apology after a reporter sent a tweet stating incorrectly that he still works for the Trump Organization.
Late Wednesday afternoon, Yahoo News' Hunter Walker, who served as a press pool reporter during Trump's transition, tweeted that he spotted "Trump Organization executive Michael Cohen at the White House."
Just spotted Trump Organization executive Michael Cohen at the White House— Hunter Walker (@hunterw) February 8, 2017 
Three hours later, Cohen replied to Hunter's tweet, informing the reporter of his mistake. Cohen accused Hunter of already knowing that he would be serving Trump in the White House as his personal lawyer, which was reported right before the Jan. 20 inauguration. Prior to accepting his new role, Cohen had served as executive vice president of the Trump Organization and special counsel to Trump.
Stay abreast of the latest developments from nation's capital and beyond with curated News Alerts from the Washington Examiner news desk and delivered to your inbox.
Sorry, there was a problem processing your email signup. Please try again later. Processing... Thank you for signing up for Washington Examiner News Alerts. You should receive your first alert soon! @hunterw I am no longer affiliated with the Trump Organization. I am personal counsel to President Donald J. Trump which you are aware of.— Michael Cohen (@MichaelCohen212) February 9, 2017 
Hunter said he wasn't aware of the job change, and offered his congratulations. He also sent out a fresh tweet formally announcing that Cohen had informed him of his job change and another with a link to a story featuring further information on Cohen's new gig.
None of that seemed to satisfy Cohen, who asked, "Where's the apology?" in response to one Twitter user's comment on the exchange.
. @peidays306 @hunterw unfortunately not when it comes to me. Where's the apology?— Michael Cohen (@MichaelCohen212) February 9, 2017 
"[A]nd they wonder why #Americans don't trust the media!" he added in reply to another.
Also from the Washington Examiner Republicans united under Trump, but trade threatens to divide the party "There is a bit of a concern on the trade issue," Mercedes Schlapp said.
By David M. Drucker • 02/09/17 12:17 AM . @RRMatheson @peidays306 @hunterw and they wonder why #Americans don't trust the media!— Michael Cohen (@MichaelCohen212) February 9, 2017 
The fledgling Trump administration has already grappled with the White House press pool in its first three weeks. Last month President Trump and his press secretary, Sean Spicer, condemned Time's Zeke Miller for reporting incorrectly (and quickly retracting) that the Martin Luther King Jr. bust in the Oval Office had been removed when Trump move in.

By Pete Kasperowicz • 02/09/17 12:01 AM Share
